MCQ: When was the term 'machine learning' coined?

Choices: a: Data mining | b: Physics | c: Chemistry | d: Biology

MCQ: Who introduced a theoretical neural structure formed by interactions among nerve cells?
Choices: a: Arthur Samuel | b: Donald Hebb | c: Walter Pitts | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What was the name of the 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cyberdyne | b: Cybernet | c: Cybertron | d: Cynetron

MCQ: Who provided a widely quoted formal definition of the algorithms studied in the machine learning field?
Choices: a: Alan Turing | b: Arthur Samuel | c: Tom M. Mitchell | d: Donald Hebb

MCQ: Which field did machine learning grow out of as a scientific endeavor?
Choices: a: Artificial intelligence | b: Robotics | c: Quantum computing | d: Nanotechnology

MCQ: In which decade did machine learning start to flourish as its own field?
What was the name of the program invented by Arthur Samuel in the 1950s that calculated the winning chance in checkers?
Choices: a: GameMaster | b: GameSolver | c: GamePlayer | d: GameLearner

MCQ: Which mathematical foundations provide the basis for machine learning?
Choices: a: Algebra | b: Calculus | c: Mathematical optimization | d: Geometry

MCQ: What is the name of the framework that provides a theoretical viewpoint for describing machine learning?
Choices: a: PAC learning | b: ML learning | c: AI learning | d: Data learning
